Well, I am a long time Bioshock fan and I was somewhat disappointed at this game, mainly for the super streamlined gameplay going away from what made the first bioshock so incredibly fun.

This game is pretty easy and very much on rails, my dog could beat it. You can now only carry 2 guns at a time and the powers feel very weak, I barely even used them.

That out of the way, I absolutely loved the setting and the story of this game. It's still worth it but I'd wait for a sale as there is no replayability value.

About the game, yes it's a masterpice. Unlike the first two games, now you're not a survivor or a Monstrous-like creature who roam an underwater city, now you're Booker DeWitt, a war veteran with unknown debts and now tasked to rescue a girl in a flying city, Columbia.
Columbia, unlike rapture, is a beatiful city. Everyone's happy until you showed up and accused for being a false sheperd. Now the whole city is your enemy, and you must fight your way to save Elizabeth, a Mysterious girl guarded by a giant steam-powered beast known as The Songbird and of course the ruler of the city, Comstock.

The game now is not about survival, it's about a fight. So, you're not spending time collecting medkits and eve or planning an attack on splicers like the first two games, It's a whole different genre. In Bioshock: infinite, the combat is fast, more weapons and ammunitions so you don't need to save ammunitions like in the first two games. Also there are Vigors, pretty much like Plasmids, but with the fast combat system, using these superpowers is much more fun as you can combine one vigor with others. and you don't have to worry about the Salts (Eve version of Bioshock Infinite) or ammunitions and medkits, because Elizabeth is one of the best NPC Companion ever (She'll find those things in a fight) 
And for the world and the story, it's pretty good. The vibe and the music of the game is awesome. I like the bond between the two main characters and i think many people would agree with me that this game has the most Mind-Fu** ending ever. 
Overall this is a very good game, you don't have to play the first two games to understand the story, Recommended!

Definitely one of the best - if not the best - games I have ever played. Since I finished it a little over a month ago, I've spent countless hours thinking about it. It really stays with you. A lot of people complain about this game and proclaim that the original BioShock is far superior. And although I immensely love the original BioShock and could agree that certain aspects of it are better (being able to hold more than two weapons, the Big Daddies), I can't seem to understand how someone could not appreciate the intense, emotional, and plain awesome story this game and its DLC deliver. While on the subject, I highly recommend Burial at Sea Episodes 1 & 2. It brings it to a conclusion that I personally found more satisfying than that of the base game, although I may be in the minority there. I find the gunplay to be an improvment, mostly because it uses BioShock 2's gun and plasmid (vigor, now) in seperate hands mechanic comapred to BioShock's nonsensical constant right clicking to switch. It also has Aim Down Sights which I always love. Anyway, I rate 9.5/10, and would like to conclude by reminding you that whatever problems you may have with the story/ending, no sane person can truthfully say it's better than the "ending" of the original, because that ending is just plain terrible.

BioShock Infinite é um dos melhores jogos já feitos. Tem uma boa variação de armas, vigores (poderes) e combinações desses vigores para causar um dano maior. Assim como os outros BioShocks, é EXTREMAMENTE recomendável que se explore o máximo possível do jogo para um maior entendimento. A coleta de Voxophones (Diários de Áudio no BioShock 1 e 2) e atenção na conversa entre Booker e Elizabeth desvenda os mistérios do jogo.

Apesar de ter Elizabeth ao seu lado, ela é extremamente útil nos combates. Ela costuma jogar em sua direção sais (com eles você utiliza os poderes), kits médicos, munição e dinheiro. A melhor parte disso tudo é que ela se protege sozinha, assim, você foca somente nas batalhas.

A DLC Burial at Sea episode One e Burial at Sea episode Two são cruciais para o entendimento da saga BioShock, pois no final do Infinite há um buraco na história que é preenchido com as DLCs (Essas duas DLCs poderiam tranquilamente serem transformadas em um novo jogo pelo tamanho de ambas). Então antes de jogar Burial at Sea, é recomendável que já tenha jogado BioShock 1 ou já tenha conhecimento do que ocorre nele.

"A mente do paciente irá lutar desesperadamente para criar memórias onde elas não existem", Barreiras para viagem transdimensional - R. Lutece, 1889.
Elizabeth: "Time... time rots everything; even hope."

BioShock Infinite - динамичная, красивая, очень интересная во всем видеоигра, в которую стоит сыграть всем любителям видеоигр. 
BioShock Infinite - стоит потраченных на нее денег и времени.

Willst du eine Frau retten? 
(Ja, Ja, dafür lebe ich!)

Möchtest du sie gerne an deiner Seite haben? 
(Ja, das wäre schön!)

Willst du dass sie dich vor dem Tode und deiner Unzulänglichkeit bewahrt? 
(Ja, hoffentlich)

Wünscht du dir einen Engel? 
(Seufz,ja)

Bist du bereit für den Engel zu sterben? 
(Aber nur wenn sie wirklich Flügel hat und mich in den Himmel trägt.)

Willst du durch eine Wolkenstadt fliegen? 
(Ja, das ist mein Traum! Fliegen, fliegen!)

Willst du in Zimmern von fremden Leuten herumschnüffeln?
(Ja, das wollte ich schon immer mal machen)

Brauchst du eine Frau an deiner Seite? 
(Ja, ich brauch jemanden um Pferde zu stehlen!)

Bist du bereit für sie zu kämpfen? 
(Ja, aber nur wenn`s nicht weh tut!)

Kannst du sie aus ihrem Gefängniss befreien? 
(Ja, im Knast kenne ich mich aus! Ich war mal verheiratet!)

Benötigst du eine Frau um deine verwahrloste Seele zu retten? 
(Oh, ja! Alleine habe ich gegen den Teufel keine Chance!)

Bist du bereit dich selbst zu erkennen? 
(Nein, davor habe ich Angst)

Ist dein Gehirn bereit um deine Umwelt zu erfassen? 
(Nein, meist hocke ich vorm PC)

Solltest du dir, nur für dich, all diese bescheuerten Fragen nicht sinnvoll beantworten können, so ist dies dein Spiel. Auch wenn du es nicht wahr haben möchtest.

[h1]          THE UNIQUE:[/h1]
💎 Unforgettable sound & music
💎 The story about dimensional time and space, revealing an alternate universe
💎 Variety combat option
💎 A charming girl as a companion
💎 Gun & Plasmid combat system

[h1]          PLAYER REQUIREMENTS:[/h1]
💼 Accept a cruel story about worship and racism
💼 Allow Elizabeth to be your companion, you have to be the main character

[h1]          GAME IMPRESSION:[/h1]
🕘 2013: Game released and love it on the first sight
🕘 2015: Brought the Season Pass and enjoy it very much!
🕘 2020: Still love it! this game is irreplaceable!

[h1]          HIGH RATED NEGATIVE FEEDBACK:[/h1]
🔧 By installing and using the Software, you consent to the information collection ➜ This is not true!

🔧 No classic features (No more Security Camera, Hacking, Crafting, Carry Health Kits, Manually save, Map for a guideline) ➜ True, but I have seen many of us ok with the changes. Now there is a DLC that return most of the feature from classic Bioshock

🔧 Uninspired combat system ➜ Limited to carry only 2 weapons, is reasonable. Added Melee execution, a regenerating shield, Lockpicks. These look fine!

[h1]              MORE INFORMATION:[/h1]
Recommended Video Review:
https://youtu.be/jSA9AsdBh00
Approximate File Size = 22 GB + DLC = 41 GB
Average Completion Hours = 11h - 16h 
Achievement Completionist = 27h

..... the word boner game pops into mind. this is how i felt about bioshock 1. maybe its because i consoled that mother and it felt like a shitty FPS had intercourse with a shitty RPG but happened to be adopted by some cool ass parents who fostered creative story telling. it was cool but it was a whatever game.

what is a boner game you ask? the preceding adjective 'boner' applies to anything that people get metaphorical (in most cases) erections about and pledge life and loyalty to it like its master shendu or something. You go in and find out the game is not THAT good. It might be okay, it might be good, it might even be unique, but it was overhyped; all it was was a boner game. Boner examples might be boner movies including inception and the dark knight (i felt like people rode the cry for the 5000 people dead at 911 train for keith (i prefer the K cuz the H makes me hungry when i say his name even though ive moved on to kettled cooked lays now) ledger saying that he did a "(boner) job!" i honestly feel that most known actors could have done a decent job as good if not better and that others could have done a 'realistic' acting choice of joker to fit the 'realistic' joker look.)

those movies were good but ill remember more about peoples 13 inch long boners over them than the actual movies....

anyways. this game is a boner game in some ways but it grows longer than the boner in other ways. if you like alternate universe themes and a fun use of cognitive dissonance like i do then itll be a treat. if crazy plot twists that make your brain hurt for unneccessary reasons (much like that picasso's face pictures) give you boners because they are 'deep' (like inception) then this is definitely the game for you and it will shock your bio to infinite boner lengths

10/10, definitely one of my favorite games of all time. I've never played the first two. but you don't even have to play them to understand the story, maybe an easter egg or two but that's it really. This game is beautiful, the graphics are amazing, and spice up your combat with Vigors, a type of attack that allows you to creatively kill your enemies. This game story, while short, can keep you interested the entire way through and the ending will leave you questioning your humanity. (Had to look up a video explanation myself) But this game is the best, the dev's obviously put a lot of work into this great game. Even if you haven't had enough it, there is 2 DLC's for it (didn't find it as enjoyable as the game itself) which are interesting to explore if you want more Bioshock. Buy this game, it is worth it.

Since this game first came out years ago I distanced myself from it and the storyline. That may have been the best thing I have ever done. If you are looking for a game that is exciting thrilling and in the end just blows away your mind, then you have found the game. It is sad knowing that this game did not receive game of the year like the previous titles but I think this is the best one to date. It is like a completely new game how different it is than the previous titles. This game surpassed all that I had hoped for in the third Bioshock and I hope they bring another one and not have it stay as a trilogy.

Да, прекрасная игра, сголасен. Ну, да, только вот для того чтобы понять концовку вам придется почитать пару книг про физику, а точнее, про "Кота Шредингера" и про квантовую неопределенность. Ну как? Лень вам? Вооот. Тут приходит Элизабет и топит вас. Вы в недоумении: "Какого черта?" А теперь, друзья мои, объясняю, что из-за той самой неопределенности, вроде как, перепутались две, скажем, параллельных вселенных. Из-за кого? Из-за нашего дорого друга, Букера. Ибо где-то он принял крещение, а где-то нет. Кажется, мы окончательно запутались. И да, спасибо, дорогой наш сценарист, что так печально закончил Burial at sea: ep.2. Спасибо, что связал предыдущие, забытые игры с Infinite ценой её   жизни. Спасибо, твою мать.
Игра очень понравилась, хорошая графика, увлекательный геймплей, офигенная концовка. 10 Элизабет из 10

[h1]BioShock Infinite[/h1] is a solid singleplayer-shooter with an interesting steampunk setting and a complex but incredibly compelling story

Over-all great experience which you shouldn't miss.

No game will ever affect me as much as BioShock Infinite did.

After playing through the game three times (twice on Xbox 360 & once on PC) it still upsets me that Irrational signed over the series permanently.

I'm going to keep this clean of any spoilers and say that this was a brilliant end to the revolution of the trilogy, and that Burial at Sea episodes One & Two are to be considered absolutely mandatory if you are to play this game properly.

This game has been one of only a few games, that has brought me to tears on more than one occasion. Call me a cry baby or whatever, but I am as passionate about this series as any fanatic is about whatever they are obsessed with.

BioShock will always have a special place in my life post of completing Infinite.

I would recommend not only this game, but BioShock, BioShock 2 also.
If you are thinking about buying this, do it, have fun, and pay attention.

Wow. Just wow. When Bioshock Infinite released, I neglected to play the game because I refused to play games with a controller, and the only computer in the house was a toaster. After playing through it I can safely say that this has got to be one of the most finely crafted games I've ever played. The guns are all punchy and fun to use, the difficulty curve is perfect, and the story is perhaps one of the most well done I've ever seen in a video game. Elizabeth is, hands down, the most useful tag-along character I've ever had the privilege to play with. She never gets in the way, can take care of herself in a fight, and tosses you ammo, coins, and health items seemingly whenever you need them. This isn't to say that she eliminates the difficulty, or that the game is too easy. I played on normal mode, and the difficulty seemed very well balanced. There were some very close calls many, many times throughout the game. I did encounter a few deaths, but pretty much all of them were my fault. I never really encountered any bugs, other than getting stuck on the geometry a few times, though none required a reset and I was free within seconds. If I were to complain about a few things, I would say that I wish that a little bit more emphasis were put on the vigors within the game. As cool as they seemed when I got each one, I found that I rarely used any of them on more than a few occasions. although this could be entirely because I was having too much blasting away enemies with my hand cannon. Another VERY small gripe I have is with some of the unusual choices for keybinds. I found that I had to do quite a bit of tweaking to some of the core buttons in order to reach a typical FPS setup, but since they can be rebound, that's hardly a complaint. I can't really find any other complaints that are worth mentioning. This game is so fun, so interesting, so beautiful, that I can whole-heartedly recommend this to anyone who plays FPS's, and I would recommend anyone who can get their hands on this game, give it a whirl. You won't be dissapointed.

I finished the game in under 11 hours, that was me playing it normal speed, looking around and looting while going through the storyline. I've only played through it once but the only negative side is I probably wouldn't play it again, but apart from that its a great game. Graphics are awesome and butter smooth as my GPU is a  GTX980 G1. 
Definately recommend!!

This is a very engaging and immersive game, but it took me only eleven hours to beat and it doesn't feel like there is much replay value. It would have helped if there were choices leading to different endings a la Bioshock and Bioshock 2.
Real gud, only paid 10$ for all bioshock, veri gr8!

This is simply one of the best game i have ever played! 
Every day i woke up i ran (Literally) to my computer to play it. It is so addictive. And the end of the game is so incredibly amazing and mind blowing that I'm was still in shock three weeks later... One might say I was still in "BioShock". (Pun intended) But seriously... I occasionally get chills down by back when I think back to this game. This is a must play game. I have not played BioShock 1&2 yet, but I have then in my library and I'm going to play them when I have time.

Some of my friends say that they don't like BioShock Infinite because it does not seem as "dark" as the first two, but I disagree. This game is "dark" but in a mental way. I don't know if the first two are "dark" mentally, visually or both. But I can say that this game is very mentally "dark". It starts off very nicely and quiet and evolves to something that is really, really "dark". 

The game looks amazing visually. I played trough the game in medium quality (because my pc was crap) and it looked amazing. I changed the quality to max sometimes just to look at the scenery in HQ and that looked even better. Even in the lowest quality (but still at 1920x1080) it looked very beautiful.

Pros:
- Elizabeth (You will understand in time)
- Looks amazing
- Runs smooth (Even on my useless 6 year old office PC I had when i played this)
- Full controller support (Playing the game with a controller instead of mouse and keyboard is heavily recommended because your hands are more still which allows me to get immersed fully and i hope it does the same for you)
- Fair price
- AMAZING story (My opinion)
- 12-18 hours gameplay (Estimate based on my time)
- Good world layout (there is no ingame map because you don't need one. I thought i was lost once! And it turned out I went the correct way. So the world is mostly open and is almost impossible to get lost in) 

Cons:
- Replayability is not really an option (for me at least). The story in the game unfolds in a way that for me makes it so there is no reason to play it again. I feel like I experienced everything the game had to offer and that every question I had was answered.

Never has there been an FPS that is more interesting and overwhelmingly deep than this. Bioshock Infinate gives an entire new meaning to the status of a role-playing game. Its combat is fun and quick, its characters are well thought-out and creative but mainly the storyline ties the previous games into a fitting end which makes the mind boggle!
